definition: to act stupid/to pretend to be naive
adornment/to adorn/dress/clothing/costume (of an actor in a play)/to play a role/to pretend/to install/to fix/to wrap (sth in a bag)/to load/to pack

sentences.english: Don't play dumb, I know that you ate the last piece of cake.
sentences.chinese: 別裝傻了，我知道是你吃了最後一塊蛋糕。

sentences.english: Michael plays dumb, replying “Never heard of the guy.”
sentences.chinese: “Michael裝傻充愣，“從沒聽說過這傢伙”。

sentences.english: Don't play dumb, I know you ate the last piece of cake.
sentences.chinese: 別裝傻了，我知道是你吃了最後一塊蛋糕。

sentences.english: I play the fool, you and I covered up the story.
sentences.chinese: 我裝傻，掩蓋了我和你的故事。

sentences.english: He always likes to play the fool.
Don't play dumb , nigger. You know who this is. You got my money?
sentences.chinese: 別裝傻黑鬼你知道我是誰你拿到錢了嗎？

sentences.english: I know that you ate the last piece of cake.
sentences.chinese: 別裝傻了，我知道是你吃了最後一塊蛋糕。

sentences.english: You say dreams are dreams. I ain't gonna play the fool anymore.
sentences.chinese: 你說，夢想就是夢想，我不打算再裝傻下去了。

definition: to act like a spoiled child/to throw a tantrum/to act coquettishly
to sound out/to probe/to feel out/to try out
to be softhearted/to be tenderhearted/to be kindhearted
to like to look good in the eyes of others/sensitive about how one is regarded by others/proud
In order to capture, one must let loose./to loosen the reins only to grasp them better
(coll.) presenting as unfriendly and blunt, but warm and tender inside (loanword from Japanese "tsundere")
